did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Professor Polisar's papers mostly concerning Civil Rights, public employment, and workplace discrimination. Also includes materials for the ILR courses he taught.

bioghist.p: Eric Polisar (June 29, 1923 July 31, 1968) was a member of the faculty at Cornell University's New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations.

A graduate of the University of Wisconsin (BA, 1949; MA, 1950), Polisar taught at the New York State Teachers College at New Paltz before joining the Extension Division of the School of Industrial and Labor Relations in 1952. From 1953 to 1961, he worked on the staff of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America. He returned to the Cornell faculty in 1961 and remained on the faculty until his death in 1968.
See the Cornell University Memorial Faculty Statement for Professor Eric Polisar: http://hdl.handle.net/1813/18855

scopecontent.p: Key to abbrevations in the papers:
OCB - The Office of Collective Bargaining
AFSCME - Ameriacn Federaton of State and Municipal Employees
ACWA - Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America
IUE - International Unino of Electric, Radio, and Machine Workers
SCHR - State Commission for Human Rights (commonly references NYS)
CCR - US Commission of Civil Rights
OFCC - Office of Federal Contract Compliance
IBEW - International Brotherhood of Elcectrical Workers
I.C.F.T.U. - International Confederation of Free Trade Unions

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.
